page.title: 07HEALTH CARE IN DOVER
page.content: BUCKLAND HOSPITAL HAS BEEN ON ITS PRESEN SITE SINCE 1930.242 PEOPLE CAN STAY OVERNIGHT.IN AN AVERAGE WEEK,63 OPERATIONS CAN BE COMPLETED.THE HOSPITAL EMPLOYS 625 PEOPLE. AMBULANCES HAVE BEEN USED SINCE THE HOSPENED.THERE ARE MORE MALE THAN FEMALE DOCTORS WORKING AT THE HOSPITAL. THE NEW BUILDINGS UNDER CONSTRUCTION WILL BE USED FOR;DAY WARDS,X RAYS,PHARMACY,PATH.LAB AND AN OPERATING THEATRE.THIS WILL COST 4 MILLION POUNDS. THE COST OF RUNNING THE HOSPITAL FOR 1 DAY IS 16,000 POUNDS.THE HOSPITAL TAKES UP 24.5 ACRES OF LAND. 20 BABIES ARE BORN IN AN AVERAGE WEEK. THE HOSPITAL CATERS FOR SPECIAL DIETS. THE CHILDREN HAVE THEIR OWN WARD WITH TOYS IN IT AND A BIG TELEVISION.
